title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CLEVELAND – History arrived not with a roar, but with a relentless, breathtaking display from Glen Rice. In a performance for the ages, Rice carried the Charlotte Hornets to a stunning 110-105 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 56 points.

From the opening tip, Rice was simply unguardable. He carved up the Cavaliers’ defense with a scintillating array of shots, hitting from deep, mid-range, and at the rim with effortless precision. The Gund Arena crowd, expecting a home victory, could only watch in a mixture of awe and horror as the tally on the scoreboard next to Rice’s name climbed into rarefied air.

While the Cavaliers, led by a valiant 29-point effort from Shawn Kemp, fought to keep pace, they had no answer for the one-man hurricane in teal and purple. Every time Cleveland threatened to build momentum or close a gap, Rice would respond with another dagger, silencing the rally and steadying his Hornets.

His 56 points were not just a number; they were a statement, a historic benchmark that etched his name into the NBA record books. It was a scoring clinic that showcased his pure, unadulterated shooting stroke and an insatiable will to win.

On this night, the game itself was secondary. The story was Glen Rice. In a virtuoso performance that will be remembered for decades, he didn't just beat the Cavaliers; he authored a masterpiece, delivering one of the most iconic individual performances in Charlotte Hornets history and stealing a victory through sheer, singular brilliance.
